intro: Diplodiscus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered diplodiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
